node.title: Whoopi Goldberg apologizes for saying Holocaust "not about race"
node.description: Goldberg said on "The View" on Monday that the Holocaust, which resulted in the deaths of more than 6 million people, was about "how people treat each other."
node.content: ["Actress and talk show host Whoopi Goldberg came under fire on Monday after saying the Holocaust was \"not about race.\"\u00a0", "Goldberg made the comments during Mondays' episode of ABC's \"The View\" as she and the other hosts were discussing how the Holocaust-centered graphic novel \"Maus\" was banned by a Tennessee school board, becoming just the latest on a lengthy list of banned books in the U.S.\u00a0", "The Pulitzer Prize winning novel is about the author and his father, Holocaust survivor Vladek Spiegelman, and the genocide's impact on their relationship. The Tennessee school board banned the book, Goldberg said, because there were complaints about the novel containing nudity and bad language.\u00a0", "\"Personally, I'm shocked because given the story of 'Maus,' I'm surprised that that's what made you uncomfortable \u2014 the fact that there was some nudity. It's about the Holocaust \u2014 the killing of 6 million people.\"", "As the hosts continued to discuss the banning of certain books, critical race theory and other hot button education issues, Goldberg circled back to the Holocaust.\u00a0", "\"If you're going to do this, then let's be truthful about it, because the Holocaust isn't about race,\" she said.\u00a0", "The other hosts paused before appearing to start to counter her argument when Goldberg continued.\u00a0", "\"It's not about race. It's about man's inhumanity to man. That's what it's about,\" she said.\u00a0", "When co-host Ana Navarro said the genocide was \"about white supremacy...and going after Jews and gypsies and Roma,\" Goldberg responded that it was \"two white groups of people.\"\u00a0", "\"The minute you turn it into race, it goes down this alley. Let's talk about it for what it is \u2014 it's how people treat each other. It's a problem. It doesn't matter if you're Black or white because Black, white, Jews \u2014 everybody.\"", "As explained by non-profit organization\u00a0Anne Frank House, Adolf Hitler had long been antisemitic prior to his rise to power in Nazi Germany. He quickly ascended to power after World War I as he blamed many Jewish people for the issues Germany, and the world, were facing at the time. He started to categorize people based on their religion, race, and ethnicity, believing that Germans without diseases, ailments, disabilities could belong to the high class.\u00a0", "The exact number of people killed during the Holocaust is not known, but the best estimates have found that the total exceeds 6 million.", "Goldberg apologized for her comments later on Monday.\u00a0", "\"On today's show, I said the Holocaust 'is not about race, but about man's inhumanity to man.' I should have said it is about both,\" Goldberg\u00a0tweeted. \"As Jonathan Greenblatt from the Anti-Defamation League shared, 'The Holocaust was about the Nazi's systematic annihilation of the Jewish people \u2014 who they deemed to be an inferior race.' I stand corrected.\"\u00a0", "\"The Jewish people around the world have always had my support and that will never waiver,\" Goldberg continued. \"I'm sorry for the hurt I have caused.\"\u00a0", "Goldberg's initial comments received significant backlash.\u00a0", "\"My Jewish family was put in concentration camps,\" tweeted Hen Mazzig, a fellow at The Tel Aviv Institute, along with what appears to be photos of his family members. \"How could you be so dismissive of the murder of 6 million Jews solely because they were Jewish?\"\u00a0", "Actor Michael Rapaport posted a video condemning Goldberg's comments, saying the genocide \"f***ing was\" about race.\u00a0", "\"It was only about race. it was about kill the Jews, exterminate the Jews. 'They're not white, they're Jewish.' That's like saying slavery wasn't about race,\" he said. \"...Not good, not cool. ... Leave the f***ing Jews alone.\"\u00a0", "The Auschwitz Museum, which is run from the largest German Nazi concentration camp and extermination center, tweeted at Goldberg a photo of a Nazi-era chart that shows how Nazi officials racially profiled people. According to the chart, a description says, \"the only racially pure people are those who have four German grandparents,\" as depicted in the four blank circles in the left-hand column of the chart.\u00a0", "The museum recommended their seven-chapter online course about the history of the Holocaust.\u00a0", "@WhoopiGoldberg \u2018Holocaust\u2013the destruction of European Jews\u2019 A seven-chapter online course about the history of the #Holocaust. ", "Links to all chapters below in the tweet below.https://t.co/Law3fQRRMS pic.twitter.com/YJqwbG9ld0", "One Holocaust survivor, 88-year-old Lucy Lipiner, even offered to go onto the show and discuss the Holocaust with the hosts.\u00a0", "\"I think we can have meaningful conversation together and heal wounds,\" she said.\u00a0", "Li Cohen is a social media producer and trending reporter for CBS News, focusing on social justice issues."]
